Since then, three million refugees have fled to neighboring countries seeking safety and assistance. With all eyes on Ukraine, sports figures from around the world are stepping up to aid in wide-ranging humanitarian efforts.

title: Shea Theodore scores in OT, Vegas beats Canadiens
description: Shea Theodore scored in overtime and the Vegas Golden Knights beat the Montreal Canadiens 4-3 Thursday night.

title: Ryan Johansen, Mikael Granlund lead Predators over Jets to stop skid
description: Ryan Johansen and Mikael Granlund each scored a goal and assisted on another to lead the Nashville Predators over the Winnipeg Jets 5-2 on Thursday night.

title: Sidney Crosby, Evgeni Malkin score as Penguins hold off Senators
description: Evgeni Malkin and Sidney Crosby scored, and the streaking Pittsburgh Penguins held off the Ottawa Senators 6-4 on Thursday night.

title: Flyers lose 10 straight for 2nd time this season
description: Make it 10 again — yes, straight defeats — for the Flyers.

title: Ryan Reaves, Adams Fox score 2 each as Rangers beat Maple Leafs
description: Ryan Reaves is used to long-scoring droughts during his 12-year career. He came through in a big way to end his latest one.

title: NHL reschedules games, season set to end on time April 29
description: The NHL on Wednesday revealed new dates for 98 games postponed for coronavirus-related reasons, keeping the end of the regular season on schedule for April 29.

title: Islanders win 4-3 in shootout, hand Flyers 9th straight loss
description: The Flyers stretched a shootout to nine rounds — only to see their losing streak reach nine games.

title: Thatcher Demko makes 31 saves as Canucks beat skidding Predators 3-1
description: Thatcher Demko made 31 saves to lead the Vancouver Canucks over the skidding Nashville Predators 3-1 on Tuesday night.

title: Christian Dvorak scores 2, Sam Montembeault saves 48, Montreal tops Dallas
description: Christian Dvorak scored twice, Sam Montembeault made a career-high 48 saves for his second win of the season and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Dallas Stars 5-3 Tuesday night for their third road win.

title: NHL pioneer Willie O'Ree 'overwhelmed' as No. 22 raised to rafters
description: Willie O’Ree’s No. 22 now has a permanent home in Boston's TD Garden.

title: NHL to stop testing asymptomatic players post-All-Star break
description: The NHL will stop testing asymptomatic players, coaches and staff who are fully vaccinated following the All-Star break in early February, saying coronavirus cases continue to decline across the league.

title: Clay Travis: Vax clearly offered NHL no benefit, but mysteriously, NFL suddenly COVID-free
description: NHL players keep being tested for COVID-19, and they keep testing positive. This despite the fact the vast majority have been vaccinated and are asymptomatic.

title: Montreal Canadiens hire player agent Kent Hughes as GM
description: The Montreal Canadiens hired player agent Kent Hughes as their general manager Tuesday, hoping he can turn around a team with the worst record in the NHL.

title: Penguins score 5 unanswered goals to rally past Golden Knights 5-3
description: Jason Zucker scored twice and the Pittsburgh Penguins rallied from an early three-goal deficit to defeat the Vegas Golden Knights 5-3 on Monday night.

title: Brock Nelson, Casey Cizikas help Islanders hand Flyers 8th straight loss
description: Brock Nelson and Casey Cizikas scored less than three minutes apart in the second period and the New York Islanders beat Philadelphia 4-1 on Monday night, handing the Flyers their eighth straight loss.

title: Jake Guentzel's OT goal lifts Penguins over Sharks
description: Jake Guentzel scored 37 seconds into overtime, Luis Domingue had 40 saves in his season debut and the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the San Jose Sharks 2-1 Saturday night.

title: Lightning hand Stars 7th straight road loss
description: Ross Colton had the tiebreaking goal on a breakaway midway through the third period, Andrei Vasilevskiy stopped 19 shots, and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat Dallas 3-1 Saturday night for the Stars' seventh consecutive road loss.

title: Chris Kreider, Adam Fox lead Rangers past Flyers
description: Chris Kreider scored with 6:30 left, fellow All-Star Adam Fox had two assists and the New York Rangers beat the slumping Philadelphia Flyers 3-2 Saturday night.

title: Taylor Hall's OT goal lifts red-hot Bruins over Predators
description: Taylor Hall scored off a rebound of David Pastrnak’s shot 1:41 into overtime, lifting the red-hot Boston Bruins to a 4-3 win over the Western Conference-leading Nashville Predators on Saturday.

title: Vitek Vanecek, Tom Wilson lead Capitals past Islanders
description: Tom Wilson scored early, Alex Ovechkin added an empty-net goal late, and Vitek Vanecek made 23 saves to lead the Washington Capitals to a 2-0 victory over the New York Islanders on Saturday.

title: Sam Bennett scores 3 goals as Panthers hammer Stars
description: Sam Bennett scored his second hat trick this season and added an assist to lead the Florida Panthers over the Dallas Stars 7-1 on Friday night.

title: Avalanche's Nathan MacKinnon on All-Star Game: 'I don't think every team should send a guy'
description: Colorado Avalanche center Nathan MacKinnon was named an All-Star for the third time in his career and made his position clear on the game, suggesting the best of the best should be included instead of one player from each team being guaranteed a spot.

title: Kings trainer makes history as first female staffer on NHL bench
description: Aisha Visram is believed to have become the first woman to work on the bench of an NHL regular-season game in any capacity when she served as athletic trainer for the Los Angeles Kings in their 6-2 win over the Pittsburgh Penguins on Thursday night.

title: Rangers' Igor Shesterkin shuts out Sharks in return to lineup
description: Igor Shesterkin made 37 saves in his return from COVID-19 protocol, Braden Schneider scored in his NHL debut and the New York Rangers beat the San Jose Sharks 3-0 on Thursday night.

title: Yegor Chinakhov, Elvis Merzlikins lead Blue Jackets past Hurricanes
description: Yegor Chinakhov scored two goals and Elvis Merzlikins posted a 31-save shutout as the Columbus Blue Jackets beat the Carolina Hurricanes 6-0 on Thursday night.

title: Steven Stamkos scores 18th goal, Lightning beat Canucks
description: Steven Stamkos scored his team-leading 18th goal, Andrei Vasilevskiy made 24 saves and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Vancouver Canucks 4-2 on Thursday night.

title: Ovechkin, McDavid, Draisaitl headline NHL All-Star roster
description: Washington star Alexander Ovechkin and high-scoring Edmonton teammates Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl headline the rosters for the NHL All-Star Weekend announced Thursday.

title: US Olympic men's hockey roster includes 15 college players
description: College players make up more than half of the U.S. Olympic hockey roster for Beijing, a significant increase from 2018 when the NHL also opted not to participate.

title: No NHL boosts Russian hopes for Olympic gold in men's hockey
description: When the National Hockey League and its players agreed to pause the season and participate in the 2022 Winter Olympics, it came with the caveat of pandemic conditions not making it impractical to go to China.

title: US, Canada women eager to resume fierce hockey rivalry
description: Forward Brianna Decker was unable to contain her enthusiasm in being selected to represent the United States in hockey for a third Olympics. She then bluntly declared the team’s one and only objective heading to the Beijing Games next month.

title: Penguins' Evgeni Malkin shines in season debut, scores twice in 4-1 win over Ducks
description: Evgeni Malkin couldn't have dreamed up a better return to the Pittsburgh Penguins' lineup.

title: Maple Leafs' William Nylander beats Robin Lehner in shootout for 4-3 win over Golden Knights
description: William Nylander scored in regulation and got the winner in a shootout as the Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Vegas Golden Knights 4-3 on Tuesday night.

title: Connecticut hockey player Teddy Balkind’s death ruled accident, NHL players share hashtag #Sticksoutforteddy
description: Last week's death of a Connecticut high school hockey player has been ruled an accident, a medical examiner declared, prompting NHL players to offer their condolences for the player and his family.

title: Rangers dominate 3rd period, finish off Ducks 4-1
description: Ryan Lindgren scored twice in the third period after Jarred Tinordi got credit for the tiebreaking goal in the New York Rangers' 4-1 victory over the Anaheim Ducks on Saturday night.

title: David Pastrnak, Brad Marchand each score twice, Bruins beat Lightning
description: David Pastrnak and Brad Marchand each scored twice, Linus Ullmark made 27 saves and the Boston Bruins beat the Tampa Bay Lightning 5-2 on Saturday night.

title: Sharks plan to terminate Evander Kane's contract over another COVID rules violation
description: The San Jose Sharks have placed forward Evander Kane on unconditional waivers with the intent to terminate the remainder of his $49 million, seven-year contract.

title: NHL leads tributes to Connecticut high school hockey player who died in freak accident
description: The Connecticut high school hockey player who died in a freak accident on the ice during a game was identified Friday, and the NHL led the outpouring of support for the teen’s family.

title: Pavel Buchnevich, Ville Husso lead Blues to win over Capitals
description: Pavel Buchnevich had two goals and an assist, Ville Husso stopped 26 shots and the St. Louis Blues beat the Washington Capitals 5-1 Friday night.

title: Andrei Svechniknov scores twice as Hurricanes beat Flames
description: Andrei Svechnikov scored two goals and the Carolina Hurricanes returned to action after nearly a week layoff by beating the Calgary Flames 6-3 on Friday night.

title: Jonathan Marchessault scores twice, Golden Knights beat Rangers
description: Jonathan Marchessault scored twice, Robin Lehner made 18 saves in his first game in nearly three weeks and the Vegas Golden Knights defeated the New York Rangers 5-1 on Thursday night.

title: Gabriel Landeskog's hat trick leads Avalanche to 7-1 win over Jets
description: Gabriel Landeskog got his fourth career hat trick and finished with four points to lead the Colorado Avalanche to a 7-1 win over the Winnipeg Jets on Thursday night.

title: Nikita Kucherov has 2 assists in return, Lightning beat Flames
description: Nikita Kucherov had a pair of nifty assists in his return from a lengthy injury during Tampa Bay's three-goal third period in the Lightning's 4-1 victory over the Calgary Flames on Thursday night.

title: Penguins win 10th straight, 6-2 over Flyers
description: Oh sure, leave it to Bryan Rust and Jake Guentzel to carry Pittsburgh's top line. Try four goals and an assist between them to keep Pittsburgh perfect over the last 10 games.

title: Tuukka Rask close to return with Bruins, signs with Providence
description: Goalkeeper Tuukka Rask is inching closer to a return to the Boston Bruins, signing a professional tryout agreement with AHL Providence on Thursday.

title: Sidney Crosby, Evan Rodrigues rally Penguins to win over Blues
description: The Pittsburgh Penguins have been the NHL’s hottest team for the better part of a month. They struggled early against the St. Louis Blues. Sidney Crosby then took over.

title: Maple Leafs send Oilers to 11th loss in 13 games
description: Ilya Mikheyev scored the tiebreaking goal on power play in the third period, and the Toronto Maple Leafs beat short-handed Edmonton 4-2 Wednesday night, handing the Oilers their 11th loss in 13 games.

title: Oilers star McDavid placed on NHL’s COVID-19 protocol list
description: Edmonton captain Connor McDavid, forward Derek Ryan and defenseman Tyson Barrie were placed on the NHL’s COVID-19 protocol list before the Oilers' game at Toronto.

title: Rangers sit atop NHL after Chris Kreider, Ryan Strome help beat Oilers
description: Chris Kreider scored his 20th goal, Ryan Strome had a goal and two assists, and the New York Rangers beat the slumping Edmonton Oilers 4-1 Monday night for their third straight win.

title: Senators-Kraken becomes 92nd NHL game postponed this season
description: The NHL on Monday postponed the Seattle Kraken’s home game scheduled for Thursday against Ottawa because of COVID-19 problems with the Senators.

title: Kraken fan awarded $10,000 scholarship after notifying Canucks assistant equipment manager of cancerous mole
description: Vancouver Canucks assistant equipment manager Brian "Red" Hamilton was working behind the bench during Seattle's first home game on Oct. 23 when a Kraken fan relentlessly tried to get his attention, something all too common at NHL games.

title: Nico Hischier scores in overtime, Devils beat Capitals
description: Nico Hischier scored his second goal of the game with 2:04 left in overtime to give the New Jersey Devils a 4-3 victory over the Washington Capitals on Sunday.

title: Mika Zibanejad has hat trick as Rangers beat Lightning
description: Mika Zibanejad set up many of Chris Kreider's team-leading 19 goals this season. On Sunday, it was Kreider getting assists on each of Zibanejad's three scores.

title: Todd McLellan earns 500th coaching win as Kings beat Flyers
description: Viktor Arvidsson tied a career high with four points and accomplished something that hasn't happened for a Los Angeles Kings player in 31 years — a goal 12 seconds into a game.

title: Jordan Kyrou keeps Blues warm with 2 goals win vs Wild
description: The St. Louis Blues boarded their bus to the game in a humorous ensemble of shorts, Hawaiian shirts and flip-flops, lightening the mood before the coldest outdoor game in NHL history.

title: Hurricanes score 7 straight goals to beat Blue Jackets
description: Brady Skjei and Steven Lorentz scored twice and the Carolina Hurricanes had the last seven goals to beat the Columbus Blue Jackets 7-4 on Saturday.

title: Minneapolis NHL Winter Classic sets record for coldest game in league history
description: Target Field in Minneapolis set the record for the coldest game in NHL history when it hosted the league's annual Winter Classic on Saturday night.

title: Sam Bennett's 2 goals lead Panthers past Canadiens
description: Sam Bennett scored twice and Sergei Bobrovsky made 29 saves to lead the Florida Panthers past the Montreal Canadiens 5-2 on Saturday for their third straight win.

title: Rangers win shootout, end Lightning's 7-game home win streak
description: Mika Zibanejad scored the lone goal in a shootout, Barclay Goodrow scored twice, and the New York Rangers stopped Tampa Bay's seven-game home winning streak by beating the Lightning 4-3 on Friday night.

title: Son of NHL legend Patrick Marleau nearly kidnapped at hotel, wife thanks 'Good Samaritans' for intervening
description: The son of San Jose Sharks legend Patrick Marleau was nearly kidnapped at a hotel this week but was reunited with his family thanks to the “Good Samaritans” that saw the incident unfold, his wife said.

title: LA Kings snap Vancouver's 7-game win streak under Boudreau
description: Adrian Kempe and Viktor Arvidsson scored in the shootout, Jonathan Quick made 17 saves and the Los Angeles Kings snapped the Vancouver Canucks' seven-game winning streak under new coach Bruce Boudreau with a 2-1 victory Thursday night.

title: Tkachuk, Gaudreau lead Flames to 6-4 win over Kraken
description: Matthew Tkachuk scored the go-ahead goal with 2:26 left and had two assists as the Calgary Flames beat the Seattle Kraken 6-4 on Thursday night in their first game in nearly three weeks.

title: Islanders beat Sabres 4-1 behind strong game from Varlamov
description: Kieffer Bellows and Anders Lee scored in the second period, Semyon Varlamov made 36 saves and the New York Islanders beat the Buffalo Sabres 4-1 on Thursday night for their third victory in four home games.

title: Canucks beat Ducks in OT for 7th straight win under Boudreau
description: J.T. Miller and the Vancouver Canucks remain unbeaten with Bruce Boudreau behind the bench.

title: Tarasenko leads Blues past Oilers in 1st game since layoff
description: Vladimir Tarasenko had a goal and two assists as the St. Louis Blues beat the Edmonton Oilers 4-2 on Wednesday night.

title: Weegar, Verhaeghe help rally Panthers past Rangers 4-3
description: MacKenzie Weegar, Carter Verhaeghe and Anthony Duclair scored in the third period to rally the Florida Panthers past the New York Rangers 4-3 on Wednesday night as both teams returned from an extended holiday break.

title: Kuznetsov scores late goal, Capitals beat Predators 5-3
description: Evgeny Kuznetsov scored a late short-handed goal in his return from an 18-day absence to put the Washington Capitals ahead for good in a 5-3 victory over the Nashville Predators on Wednesday night.

title: NHL players vent frustration over being barred from Olympics
description: Brad Marchand is not happy. Neither is Vladimir Tarasenko. And they are not alone.

title: US forfeits world junior game after 2 players test positive
description: The USA was forced to forfeit its game at the world junior championship against Switzerland on Tuesday after two players tested positive for the coronavirus.

title: Stricter Canadian rules complicate NHL push through pandemic
description: Sixteen months after choosing Canada as the safest place to complete its season, the NHL now faces a series of hurdles north of the border that complicate its bid to power through the pandemic all over again.

title: US names Quinn coach, Vanbiesbrouck GM for no-NHL Olympics
description: David Quinn was supposed to be an assistant on Mike Sullivan's coaching staff for the U.S. men's hockey team at the upcoming Winter Olympics.

title: Rangers forward calls for NHL to make changes to COVID protocols
description: New York Rangers forward Ryan Strome is spending his holiday season jealous of his contemporaries within the NFL and NBA.

title: NHL postpones 14 games; won't resume play until Tuesday
description: The NHL pushed back its return from an already extended holiday break an extra day by postponing its entire 14-game Monday schedule for COVID-19 testing reasons.

title: Bills update COVID vaccination policy at home games to include fans age 5 and older
description: The Buffalo Bills announced Wednesday that anyone ages 5 and older will now be required to show proof of vaccination in order to attend games at Highmark Stadium, effective immediately.

title: NHL players will not participate in 2022 Beijing Olympics amid rise of Omicron variant of COVID-19
description: The NHL’s long-awaited return to the Winter Olympics ended on Wednesday after the league announced that players will no longer be able to attend the Games in Beijing after an uptick in COVID-19 cases this month caused the NHL to postpone 50 regular-season games.

title: Enes Freedom reacts to NHL players withdrawing from Beijing Olympics
description: NBA player Enes Kanter Freedom says no one should attend the Beijing Olympics over China's history of human rights violations.

title: NHL won't participate in Beijing Olympics: Jim Gray
description: Fox News contributor Jim Gray has the latest on sports leagues’ responses to the omicron variant on ‘The Story.’

title: Pavelski, Lindell score early as Stars beat Wild 7-4
description: Joe Pavelski and Esa Lindell scored on the first two Dallas shots on goal, and the Stars never trailed in defeating the Minnesota Wild 7-4 on Monday night.

title: NHL says it will pause season due to COVID-19 concerns
description: The NHL took to Twitter late Monday to announce a brief pause to its season, two games before a scheduled Christmas break due to the surge in COVID-19 cases.

title: Blue Jackets, Canadiens shut down, 9 of 32 NHL teams paused
description: More than a quarter of NHL teams have been shut down through at least the weekend, after the Columbus Blue Jackets and Montreal Canadiens became the eighth and ninth to have activities paused because of several positive COVID-19 test results among players.

title: Golden Knights edge Islanders in Robin Lehner's return
description: Shea Theodore scored twice and added another in the shootout, former Islander Robin Lehner made 29 saves and the Vegas Golden Knights beat New York 4-3 on Sunday for their fifth straight victory.

title: NHL mulls player participation in Olympics over recent COVID issues
description: The NHL is mulling keeping players home instead of sending them to Beijing for the Winter Olympics in two months over the recent COVID-19 outbreak that is ravishing teams.

title: Red Wings GM Steve Yzerman: Why are we testing athletes with no symptoms?
description: Former NHL star and current Detroit Red Wings general manager Steve Yzerman has spoken out about testing healthy athletes for COVID as the NHL, NFL and NBA have become ravaged with reported cases.

title: Hurricanes get huge help from Jesperi Kotkaniemi and Jesper Fast in 5-1 win
description: A revamped lineup hasn’t slowed down the Carolina Hurricanes. They’re still clicking at an impressive pace.

title: Blaming omicron variant, NHL resumes daily COVID-19 testing
description: The NHL reintroduced stricter COVID-19 protocols Saturday that include daily testing and other steps in a bid to limit a growing outbreak among players and team personnel.

title: Clayton Keller scores twice, Coyotes beat Ducks in OT to snap skid
description: Clayton Keller had two goals and an assist, including a wrist shot 2:09 into overtime, giving the Arizona Coyotes a 6-5 win over the Anaheim Ducks on Friday night.

title: NHL postpones Bruins-Canadiens game due to COVID-19 cases
description: The NHL has postponed Saturday's game between Boston and Montreal amid a rise in COVID-19 cases around the league.

title: Oilers end 6-game skid with win over Blue Jackets
description: Jesse Puljujarvi had two goals and an assist and the Edmonton Oilers snapped a six-game skid with a 5-2 win over the Columbus Blue Jackets on Thursday night.

title: Andrei Vasilevskiy sets wins record, Lightning beat Senators
description: Andrei Vasilevskiy set an NHL record for wins in a calendar year, Steven Stamkos picked up his 900th career point and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Ottawa Senators 2-1 on Thursday night.

title: Canadiens and Flyers to play in empty Bell Centre
description: The Montreal Canadiens and Philadelphia Flyers were to play in an empty Bell Centre on Thursday night due to a spiraling rise of COVID-19 cases.

title: Bruins put 3 more players in COVID-19 protocol
description: The Boston Bruins placed forwards Anton Blidh and Trent Frederic and goalie Jeremy Swayman in the NHL’s COVID-19 protocol on Thursday.

title: Kakko scores twice, Rangers rally late to beat Coyotes 3-2
description: Kaapo Kakko had two goals, including the game-winner with 2:18 left, and the New York Rangers scored twice on the power play in the final six minutes to beat the Arizona Coyotes 3-2 on Wednesday night.

title: Terry, Grant propel first-place Ducks past Kraken, 4-1
description: Troy Terry scored his 18th goal and Derek Grant got one short-handed in the Anaheim Ducks' fourth victory in five games, 4-1 over the Seattle Kraken on Wednesday night.

title: US sports leagues cope with COVID-19 outbreaks amid variants
description: U.S. sports leagues are seeing rapidly increasing COVID-19 outbreaks with dozens of players in health and safety protocols, amid an ongoing surge by the delta variant of the coronavirus and rising cases of the highly transmissible omicron mutation.

title: Chicago Blackhawks settle lawsuit with Kyle Beach
description: The Chicago Blackhawks have settled a lawsuit by a former player who said he was sexually assaulted by an assistant coach during the team's 2010 Stanley Cup title run.

title: Flames, Boston, Nashville latest NHL teams hit by virus woes
description: The NHL's coronavirus situation worsened Wednesday as players and staff from three more teams were added to the league's COVID-19 protocol list, including seven players, three coaches and seven support staff with the Calgary Flames.

title: Wild's Guerin promoted to take over as US men's Olympic GM
description: Minnesota Wild general manager Bill Guerin was named Tuesday to take over the men's U.S. Olympic hockey team two months after Stan Bowman’s resignation in the wake of the Chicago Blackhawks’ sexual assault scandal.

title: Bruins place Marchand, Smith in COVID-19 protocol
description: The Boston Bruins have placed forwards Brad Marchand and Craig Smith in the NHL's COVID-19 protocol, meaning they will miss Tuesday night's game against the Vegas Golden Knights and possibly as many as six games in all.

title: NHL postpones 3 Flames games due to COVID-19 outbreak
description: The NHL has postponed the Calgary Flames’ next three games after six players and a staff member entered the league’s COVID-19 protocol over a 24-hour period.

title: Lindgren, Blues send Canadiens to sixth straight loss, 4-1
description: Charlie Lindgren made 22 saves and Pavel Buchnevich had a goal and assist, leading the St. Louis Blues to a 4-1 win over the slumping Montreal Canadiens on Saturday night.

title: Parise, Greene lead Islanders to first win at new arena
description: The New York Islanders finally won a game at their new arena on Saturday evening, beating division rival New Jersey 4-2 with the help of two former Devils captains.

title: Van Riemsdyk scores 2, Flyers deal Arizona 5th straight loss
description: James van Riemsdyk scored two goals and Patrick Brown scored his first goal of the season, leading the Philadelphia Flyers to a 5-3 victory over the Arizona Coyotes on Saturday night.

title: NHL admits it made wrong call in disallowing Sabres' goal
description: The NHL announced it made the wrong call in disallowing what would have been the Buffalo Sabres’ tying goal in the final minute of a 2-1 loss to the New York Rangers.

title: Avalanche score 7 in 3rd straight, cruise past Red Wings 7-3
description: Andre Burakovsky had two goals, Darren Helm scored in his first game against his former team, and the Colorado Avalanche became the first team in 26 years to score seven goals in three straight games with a 7-3 victory over the Detroit Red Wings on Friday night.

title: Flyers end 10-game winless skid, hit jackpot in Vegas 4-3
description: Max Willman scored his first NHL goal and the Philadelphia Flyers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 4-3 on Friday night to end a 10-game winless streak.

title: Wild beat Sharks 5-2 for 8th straight win
description: Jordan Greenway scored twice and the Minnesota Wild beat the San Jose Sharks 5-2 on Thursday night for their eighth straight win.

title: Walker's 1st hat trick lifts Blues to 6-2 win over Red Wings
description: Nathan Walker scored his first career hat trick and fourth-string goaltender Charlie Lindgren made 29 saves, leading the St. Louis Blues to a 6-2 victory Thursday night over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Stamkos has 4-point game, Lightning beat Maple Leafs 5-3
description: Steven Stamkos scored early and set up Tampa Bay's final three goals as the Lightning beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-3 on Thursday night.

title: Golden Knights rally for 5-4 win, end Stars' 7-game run
description: Mark Stone had two goals and Max Pacioretty scored the winner as the Vegas Golden Knights defeated the Dallas Stars 5-4 on Wednesday night.

title: Canucks beat Bruins 2-1 in SO, Boudreau improves to 2-0
description: J.T. Miller scored the shootout winner, giving the Vancouver Canucks a 2-1 victory over the visiting Boston Bruins on Wednesday night.

title: Blackhawks' Jujhar Khaira released from hospital after scary hit by Rangers' Jacob Trouba
description: Chicago Blackhawks forward Jujhar Khaira was released from the hospital Wednesday morning after a scary hit during Tuesday’s game against the New York Rangers that left him motionless on the ice before being carted off in a stretcher.

title: Zegras' over-the-net flip lifts Ducks over Sabres, 2-0
description: Trevor Zegras flipped a pass over the net to set up the go-ahead goal, Anthony Stolarz made 25 saves and the Anaheim Ducks beat the Buffalo Sabres 2-0 Tuesday night.

title: Islanders snap 11-game skid with 5-3 win over Senators
description: The New York Islanders can finally exhale after snapping an 11-game losing streak.

title: Talbot denies old team, Wild top Oilers 4-1 for 7th straight
description: Cam Talbot made 38 saves against his former team and the Minnesota Wild shut down the Edmonton Oilers 4-1 on Tuesday night for their seventh straight victory.

title: Hertl's hat trick leads Sharks past Flames 5-3
description: Tomas Hertl scored his fourth career hat trick and the San Jose Sharks used a three-goal barrage in the second period to beat the Calgary Flames 5-3 on Tuesday night.

title: Boudreau's 1st game coaching Canucks is 4-0 win over Kings
description: Thatcher Demko made 30 saves and Bruce Boudreau won his first game as coach of the Vancouver Canucks in a 4-0 victory over the Los Angeles Kings on Monday night.

title: Carlson comes up big in Caps' 4-3 shootout win over Ducks
description: John Carlson tied the game late in the second period and then scored Washington's third and final shootout goal to give the Capitals' a 4-3 victory over the Anaheim Ducks on Monday night.

title: Flyers fire Vigneault amid skid; Yeo named interim coach
description: The Philadelphia Flyers fired coach Alain Vigneault on Monday following eight straight losses, two shy of matching a team record of 10 in a row, and with the franchise far from ending a 47-year Stanley Cup drought.

title: Dadonov, Pacioretty, Roy lift Vegas over Calgary, 3-2
description: Evgenii Dadonov scored his seventh goal of the season and the Vegas Golden Knights beat the Calgary Flames 3-2 on Sunday night.

title: Struggling Canucks name Boudreau coach amid leadership purge
description: The Vancouver Canucks named veteran Bruce Boudreau coach following a leadership purge late Sunday night in which three executives and head coach Travis Green were let go.

title: Wheeler plays 1,000th NHL game, Jets top Maple Leafs 6-3
description: Blake Wheeler had two assists in his 1,000th NHL game and Connor Hellebuyck made 32 saves, leading the Winnipeg Jets to a 6-3 win over the Toronto Maple Leafs on Sunday night.

title: Kempe's two goals help put Kings over Oilers, 5-1
description: Adrian Kempe scored a pair of goals and the Los Angeles Kings snapped a two-game skid with a 5-1 win over the Edmonton Oilers on Sunday night.

title: Blackhawks win 3-2 in SO; Islanders lose 11th straight game
description: Patrick Kane scored the only goal in the shootout and the Chicago Blackhawks beat the Islanders 3-2 Sunday night, sending New York to its 11th straight loss overall and its sixth straight setback its new arena.

title: Perry, McDonagh lead Lightning in 7-1 win over flat Flyers
description: Corey Perry had two goals and an assist and Ryan McDonagh scored and had a pair of assists to lead the Tampa Bay Lightning to a 7-1 victory over the slumping Philadelphia Flyers on Sunday night.

title: Columbus snaps 4-game skid, rallies to beat San Jose 6-4
description: Adam Boqvist scored twice, Andrew Peeke had two assists and the Columbus Blue Jackets snapped a four-game losing streak with a 6-4 come-from-behind win over the San Jose Sharks on Sunday night.

title: Guentzel scores 3 in 2nd period, Penguins beat Canucks 4-1
description: Jake Guentzel scored three goals in the second period and added an assist as the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the Vancouver Canucks 4-1 on Saturday night.

title: Strome, Panarin lead Rangers to 3-2 win over Blackhawks
description: Artemi Panarin and Ryan Strome each had a goal and two assists, and the New York Rangers beat the Chicago Blackhawks 3-2 on Saturday night for their sixth straight win.

title: Teravainen scores twice, Hurricanes sock Sabres 6-2
description: Teuvo Teravainen scored two goals and the Carolina Hurricanes rode an early burst of offense to a 6-2 win over the Buffalo Sabres on Saturday night.

title: Red Wings hand Islanders 10th straight loss, 4-3 in OT
description: Moritz Seider scored 3:33 into overtime and the Detroit Red Wings beat the Islanders 4-3 Saturday night, handing New York its 10th straight loss.

title: Ovechkin beats Tarasov for 750th goal, Capitals top Columbus
description: Alex Ovechkin found a new goaltender to score on for another milestone goal, though this time the name rang a bell.

title: Gaudreau, Tkachuk lead Flames over Ducks in shootout
description: Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Tkachuk scored in the shootout and the Calgary Flames beat the Anaheim Ducks 4-3 on Friday night.

title: Kaprizov scores twice, Wild roll to 5-2 win against Devils
description: Kirill Kaprizov had two goals and an assist as the Minnesota Wild kept rolling with a 5-2 win against the New Jersey Devils on Thursday night.

title: Swayman's 42 saves leads Bruins over Predators 2-0
description: Jeremy Swayman made 42 saves, Jake DeBrusk and Brandon Carlo scored, and the Boston Bruins beat the Nashville Predators 2-0 Thursday night.

title: Karlsson scores in OT to give Sharks 2-1 win over Islanders
description: Erik Karlsson scored 39 seconds into overtime to give the San Jose Sharks a 2-1 victory over the Islanders on Thursday night, handing New York its ninth straight loss.

title: Panthers come back from 3 down again to beat Sabres 7-4
description: Anton Lundell scored twice, including the go-ahead goal, and the Florida Panthers came back from three down for the second straight game to beat the Buffalo Sabres 7-4 on Thursday night.

title: Makar, Avalanche bounce back, beat Canadiens 4-1
description: Cale Makar scored to put Colorado ahead to stay late in the second period, Valeri Nichushkin had a goal and an assist, and the Avalanche beat the Montreal Canadiens 4-1 on Thursday night.

title: Rasmus Asplund's 2nd goal in OT puts Sabres past Ducks 4-3
description: Rasmus Asplund scored his second goal with 43.9 seconds left in overtime, and the Buffalo Sabres blew a three-goal lead before rallying for a 4-3 victory over the Anaheim Ducks on Thursday night.

title: Compher scores twice in Colorado's 4-3 win over St. Louis
description: J.T. Compher scored two goals, leading the Colorado Avalanche to a 4-3 victory over St. Louis on Thursday and handing the Blues their first loss this season.

title: Killorn scores 2, Tampa Bay beats Arizona for 1st home win
description: Alex Killorn scored twice in the first period and the Tampa Bay Lightning earned their first home victory of the season, beating the Arizona Coyotes 5-1 on Thursday night.

title: Andersen’s SO sends Hurricanes to franchise-best 6-0-0 start
description: Frederik Andersen made 33 saves for his first shutout with Carolina, giving the Hurricanes their best six-game start in franchise history with a 3-0 win over the Boston Bruins on Thursday night.

title: Markstrom records another shutout, Flames top Penguins 4-0
description: Jacob Markstrom stopped 45 shots for his second shutout in his last three starts, and the Calgary Flames beat the Pittsburgh Penguins 4-0 Thursday night.

title: Joel Quenneville out as Panthers coach in wake of Blackhawks sexual assault investigation revelations
description: Joel Quenneville, the coach of the undefeated Florida Panthers and former coach of the Chicago Blackhawks, who has been engulfed in a sexual assault scandal, resigned Thursday days after an investigation into the controversy yielded startling results.

title: Blackhawks stars defend former GM, executive in wake of sexual assault investigation revelations
description: Chicago Blackhawks stars Jonathan Toews and Patrick Kane both reacted Wednesday to the departures of former president of hockey operations Stan Bowman and executive Al MacIsaac in the wake of the sexual assault scandal.

title: Flyers score twice in 3rd, win 5-3 to hand Oilers 1st loss
description: Cam Atkinson scored two goals and the Philadelphia Flyers beat the Edmonton Oilers 5-3 on Wednesday night.

title: Dadonov lifts Golden Knights to 3-2 OT win over Stars
description: Evgenii Dadonov scored in overtime to give the Vegas Golden Knights a 3-2 comeback victory over the Dallas Stars on Wednesday night.

title: Maple Leafs snap losing streak in 3-2 OT win over Blackhawks
description: William Nylander scored in overtime to lift the Toronto Maple Leafs over the Chicago Blackhawks 3-2 on Wednesday.

title: Bobrovsky makes 29 saves as Panthers stay undefeated
description: The Florida Panthers became the 14th team in NHL history to start 7-0-0 by beating the Boston Bruins 4-1 on Wednesday night — with coach Joel Quenneville on the bench a day after he was named in a report about the Chicago Blackhawks improperly handling sexual assault claims.

title: Quenneville's meeting with Bettman may decide Florida fate
description: Joel Quenneville remained in place as coach of the Florida Panthers on Wednesday, one day before he travels to New York for a meeting with NHL Commissioner Gary Bettman that will likely determine if he can keep his job.

title: Kyle Beach comes forward as subject of alleged abuse by Blackhawks coach
description: The John Doe who accused former Blackhawks video coordinator Brad Aldrich of sexual assault came forward in an interview with TSN on Wednesday evening.

title: Ehlers' 2 late goals powers Winnipeg past Ducks 4-3
description: Nikolaj Ehlers scored twice 19 seconds apart in the third period as the Winnipeg Jets rallied for a 4-3 victory over the Anaheim Ducks on Tuesday night.

title: Time to panic? Vegas, Colorado, Toronto off to rough starts
description: By the time the St. Louis Blues won their fifth consecutive game to open the season, the Florida Panthers had already become the first team since 2015 to open with six victories in a row.

title: Dumba goal helps Wild spoil Vancouver's home opener 3-2
description: Matt Dumba scored his first goal of the season midway through the third period, leading the Minnesota Wild to a 3-2 victory over Vancouver on Tuesday night, spoiling the Canucks home opener.

title: Flames use 4-goal outburst in 1st period to beat Devils 5-3
description: The Calgary Flames keep winning on the road, and Andrew Mangiapane's scoring is a major reason.

title: Blue Jackets' Elvis Merzlikins says Stars fan taunted him about Matiss Kivlenieks' death before game
description: The Columbus Blue Jackets are attempting to identify a fan after goaltender Elvis Merzlikins said someone wearing a Dallas Stars sweater taunted him about the tragic death of teammate Matiss Kivlenieks before Monday night’s game, according to one report.

title: Kraken rout: Seattle topples Montreal 5-1 for first home win
description: Without the pressure of three years of anticipation hanging over them, the Seattle Kraken felt free and loose going into the second home game in franchise history.

title: Bowman out as GM of US men's Olympic hockey team
description: Stan Bowman has resigned as general manager of the U.S men’s hockey team at the 2022 Winter Olympics after an investigation into sexual assault allegations in 2010 with the Chicago Blackhawks revealed he knew about the situation and did not report it to authorities.

title: Blackhawks GM Bowman resigns after sexual assault probe
description: Stan Bowman, the Chicago Blackhawks' general manager and president of hockey operations, resigned Tuesday after an investigation commissioned by the team found he was among a group of leaders who failed to respond promptly to allegations that an assistant coach sexually assaulted a player in 2010.

title: Hofmann nets 1st NHL goal, Blue Jackets defeat Dallas 4-1

title: Oshie's hat trick lifts Capitals over Senators, 7-5

title: Andersen stops former team, streaking Hurricanes beat Leafs
description: Frederik Andersen made 24 saves against his former team and the unbeaten Carolina Hurricanes matched the best five-game start in franchise history by defeating the struggling Toronto Maple Leafs 4-1 on Monday night.

title: Coleman, Backlund lead Flames to 5-1 win over Rangers
description: Andrew Mangiapane scored twice and the Calgary Flames beat the New York Rangers 5-1 on Monday night for their third straight win.

title: Panthers stay unbeaten, beat Coyotes 5-3 to move to 6-0

title: Olofsson scores twice, Sabres beat Lightning 5-1

title: Sabres’ Jack Eichel pleading with team to allow proper procedure on herniated disk
description: Jack Eichel is giving it one last go in trying to convince the Sabres to allow him to undergo a disk replacement on his neck, per ESPN’s Emily Kaplan.

title: Josi's 4-point game fuels Predators 5-2 victory over Wild

title: Oilers beat Vegas 5-3, extend season-opening win streak to 5

title: Pens' star Crosby: Still no timetable for return from injury

description: Edmonton Oilers center Connor McDavid, Toronto Maple Leafs center Auston Matthews and Colorado Avalanche forward Nathan MacKinnon have been named the finalists for the Hart Trophy as NHL MVP.

title: Avs coach misses skate after virus testing 'irregularity'
description: Coach Jared Bednar missed the Colorado Avalanche’s morning skate in Las Vegas on Thursday after what the team called an “irregularity” in his COVID-19 test.

title: Islanders fans belt out National Anthem in viral moment ahead of Game 6 victory over Bruins
description: Nassau Coliseum was roaring with energy Wednesday night as fans in attendance belted out the National Anthem before the New York Islanders Game 6 victory over the Boston Bruins in a viral moment that is sure to give anyone chills.

title: Islanders beat Bruins 6-2 in Game 6, reach Stanley Cup semis
description: The New York Islanders got another big second period and ran past the Boston Bruins for a return trip to the Stanley Cup semifinals.

title: Islanders eliminate Bruins, return to Stanley Cup semifinals
description: The New York Islanders fell behind after three games for the second straight series. Each time, they won three straight to advance, and now they're headed to the Stanley Cup semifinals for the second straight year.

title: Officiating takes center stage midway through NHL playoffs
description: Officiating has been on center stage midway through the NHL playoffs.

title: Stone scores early in OT, Knights beat Avs 3-2 in Game 5
description: Mark Stone blocked a shot on the defensive end and by the time he spun around, a pass was waiting for him with nothing but clear sailing ahead.

title: Lightning eliminate Hurricanes, advance to Cup semifinals
description: Brayden Point and Ross Colton scored and Andrei Vasilevskiy controlled the crease, helping the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Carolina Hurricanes 2-0 on Tuesday night to win the second-round playoff series in five games.

title: Bruins coach Cassidy fined $25,000 for criticizing refs
description: The NHL fined Bruins coach Bruce Cassidy $25,000 on Tuesday for his criticism of the officials after Game 4 of Boston's second-round playoff series against the New York Islanders.

title: Islanders win 5-4 to take 3-2 lead in series over Bruins
description: With five minutes left and his New York Islanders bleeding away their three-goal lead, coach Barry Trotz called a timeout and told his players to breathe.

title: Toffoli's OT goal leads Canadiens to series sweep of Jets
description: Tyler Toffoli scored at 1:39 of overtime, lifting the Montreal Canadiens to a 3-2 victory over the Winnipeg Jets on Monday night and a four-game sweep of their second-round playoff series.

title: Canadiens rout Jets 5-1 to take 3-0 series lead
description: Joel Armia had two goals and an assist, Carey Price made 26 saves, and the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Winnipeg Jets 5-1 on Sunday night to take a 3-0 lead in their second-round playoff series.

title: Canada beats Finland 3-2 in OT for 27th world hockey title
description: Nick Paul scored in overtime on a 2-and-1 break with Ottawa Senators teammate Connor Brown and Canada won its 27th world hockey title, beating Finland 3-2 on Sunday night.

title: Canada grants NHL cross-border travel exemption for playoffs
description: The NHL received an exemption from Canadian health officials allowing cross-border travel for teams starting in the semifinal round of the Stanley Cup playoffs, the league announced on Sunday.

title: Barzal scores late, Islanders beat Bruins 4-1 in Game 4
description: Mathew Barzal was at the right place at the right time for the New York Islanders.

title: Kucherov, Stamkos shine, lift Lightning over Hurricanes 6-4
description: Just when it seemed the game might be slipping away, Nikita Kucherov asserted himself for the Tampa Bay Lightning.

title: Carey Price, Canadiens beat Jets 1-0 for 2-0 series lead
description: Carey Price made 30 saves for his eighth career playoff shutout and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Winnipeg Jets 1-0 on Friday night to take a 2-0 lead in the second-round playoff series.

title: Marchessault, Pacioretty score late to lift Vegas past Avs
description: Vegas Golden Knights coach Peter DeBoer said Thursday one goal could get a raucous home crowd involved and make the difference in a playoff game.

title: Marchand scores in OT, Bruins beat Islanders 2-1 in Game 3
description: Brad Marchand knew he didn't have a great angle on his shot in overtime. He just fired the puck at the net and it got past Islanders goalie Semyon Varlamov.

title: Staal scores in OT, Hurricanes beat Lightning in Game 3
description: Jordan Staal scored on a power play at 5:57 of overtime to give the Carolina Hurricanes a 3-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Thursday night in Game 3 of the second-round series.

title: Jets' Scheifele suspended 4 games for late hit on Evans
description: Winnipeg Jets forward Mark Scheifele was suspended for four games by the NHL on Thursday night for a crushing late hit on Montreal's Jake Evans in Game 1 of the second-round series.

title: Maple Leafs' legend Doug Gilmour slams fan on social media after jersey-burning post
description: Hell hath no fury like a scorned Maple Leafs fan.

title: US advances to world hockey semifinals; Germans stun Swiss
description: Colin Blackwell and Conor Garland scored two goals apiece Thursday, and the United States advanced to the semifinals of hockey's world championship with a 6-1 victory over Slovakia.

title: Canadiens' Game 1 win tempered by late hit on Jake Evans
description: Jesperi Kotkaniemi and Eric Staal scored early goals and Montreal beat the Winnipeg Jets 5-3 on Wednesday night in Game 1 of the second-round series, a victory tempered by a scary late-game hit on Canadiens center Jake Evans.

title: Rantanen scores OT winner, Avs up 2-0 in series vs. Knights
description: Mikko Rantanen found himself in the middle of an on-ice swarm from teammates after scoring the winner.

title: Last-place Sabres win draft lottery; Kraken get No. 2 pick
description: The Buffalo Sabres won the NHL draft lottery and the expansion Seattle Kraken jumped up the order to take the No. 2 pick Wednesday night.

title: Maple Leafs' John Tavares: Memory about scary Game 1 hit still hazy
description: Toronto Maple Leafs center John Tavares opened up about the scary hit he received from Montreal Canadiens forward Corey Perry during Game 1 of their first-round playoff matchup.

title: Vasilevskiy, Tampa Bay top Carolina 2-1 for 2-0 series lead
description: Andrei Vasilevskiy has spent two games turning nearly every shot away for the Tampa Bay Lightning. A couple more, and the reigning Stanley Cup champions could be headed to the next round.

title: US wins group at world hockey, Canada reaches quarterfinals
description: Kevin Labanc and Conor Garland scored two goals apiece and the United States won its sixth straight game with a 4-2 victory over Italy in its final preliminary game at the world hockey championship on Tuesday.

title: Price has 30 saves, Canadiens top Maple Leafs 3-1 in Game 7
description: The Montreal Canadiens faced elimination three times against the Toronto Maple Leafs. And they brushed off the pressure each time.

title: Cizikas' OT goal lifts Islanders past Bruins 4-3 in Game 2
description: Casey Cizikas saw the open ice ahead. And he knew the Boston defense would be coming on quickly.

title: Vegas' Reaves suspended 2 games by NHL for hit vs. Avalanche
description: Vegas forward Ryan Reaves was suspended two games by the NHL on Monday for his roughing and unsportsmanlike conduct on Colorado's Ryan Graves during the Golden Knights' 7-1 loss in Game 1 of their second-round series Sunday.

title: US beats Germany 2-0 for 5th straight win at worlds
description: Cal Petersen had 33 saves for his second consecutive shutout and the United States won its fifth straight game at world hockey championship with a 2-0 victory over Germany on Monday.

title: Beleaguered Maple Leafs fans offer 'sacrifice' to 'hockey gods' before pivotal Game 7 in playoffs
description: Toronto Maple Leafs fans gave an offering to the “hockey gods” Monday in hopes of reversing the team’s luck in the playoffs before Game 7 against the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Golden Knights' Ryan Reaves under fire for dangerous hit on Avalanche player
description: Vegas Golden Knights defenseman Ryan Reaves drew scrutiny during the team’s loss to the Colorado Avalanche on Sunday night in Game 1 of their playoff matchup.

title: Avalanche blaze past Knights 7-1 in penalty-filled Game 1
description: The book on Nathan MacKinnon and the Colorado Avalanche: They're extremely speedy.

title: Goodrow helps Lightning beat Hurricanes 2-1 in series opener
description: Andrei Vasilevskiy turned away almost everything, while Barclay Goodrow came through with an opportunistic go-ahead goal midway through the third period.

title: Canadiens beat Maple Leafs 3-2 in OT to force Game 7
description: Jesperi Kotkaniemi scored at 15:15 of overtime and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 3-2 on Saturday night to force Game 7 in the first-round series.

title: Janmark has hat trick to lead Vegas to Game 7 win over Wild
description: Mattias Janmark had scored just one goal since being acquired by Vegas at the trade deadline from Chicago.

title: Sports fans come back to arenas and stadiums after year at home -- and so does their wild behavior
description: The PGA Championship, MLB regular season, NBA playoffs and Stanley Cup playoffs have all returned with the one thing that was missing in 2020: the fans.

title: Resilient Hurricanes push through OT-heavy series to advance
description: The Carolina Hurricanes spent their first-round playoff series falling behind early and grinding through tough overtime games.

title: Carolina rallies, eliminates Preds with 4-3 Game 6 OT win
description: The Carolina Hurricanes finally figured out how to beat the Nashville Predators in overtime: Score quickly.

title: Canadiens beat Maple Leafs 4-3 in OT to force Game 6
description: Nick Suzuki scored 59 seconds into overtime and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 4-3 on Thursday night, rebounding after blowing a three-goal lead to force Game 6 in the Original Six first-round matchup.

title: US beats Latvia 4-2 in world hockey championship
description: Trevor Moore and 18-year-old Matty Beniers scored in a 1:47 span midway through the second period to help the United States beat Latvia 4-2 on Thursday in the world hockey championship.

title: NHL pandemic playoffs outside bubble off to thrilling start
description: Paul Maurice learned through almost 2,000 games behind an NHL bench that scoring or giving up a goal gives a team about five minutes to maintain the momentum or stem the tide — especially in the playoffs.

title: Golden Knights host a Game 7 for 1st time against Minnesota
description: The payoff for sharing the NHL’s best record comes Friday night for the Vegas Golden Knights.

title: Maple Leafs' John Tavares back on the ice days after scary hit to the head
description: Toronto Maple Leafs center John Tavares was spotted at the Scotiabank Arena on Thursday morning skating about a week after taking a devastating hit to the head during the series against the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Fiala, Wild force Game 7 with 3-0 victory over Vegas
description: The Minnesota Wild have proven themselves to be a tough out. The Vegas Golden Knights could use some work on their finishing touch.

title: Vasilevskiy, Lightning beat Panthers 4-0 to advance
description: Andrei Vasilevskiy wrapped up a series with a Game 6 shutout for the second straight time, stopping 29 shots in the Tampa Bay Lightning’s 4-0 victory over the Florida Panthers on Wednesday night.

description: Brock Nelson scored twice in New York's three-goal second period and the Islanders advanced to the second round of the playoffs with a 5-3 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in Game 6 on Wednesday night.

title: Nashville, Montreal out to avoid elimination in first round
description: There is no place like home for the Nashville Predators trying to avoid elimination.

title: 1st sportsbook at major pro sports arena opens in Washington
description: The first full-service sportsbook at a major sports arena or stadium in the United States opened its doors Wednesday at the home of the NBA's Washington Wizards and NHL's Capitals.

title: Toronto blanks Montreal 4-0 for a 3-1 lead in playoff series
description: Alex Galchenyuk had plenty of memorable nights inside the Bell Centre. His latest standout performance pushed his former team to the brink of playoff elimination.

title: Staal scores in OT, lifts Hurricanes past Predators 3-2
description: Coach Rod Brind'Amour figured the puck would eventually have to bounce the right way for his Carolina Hurricanes.

title: Wayne Gretzky steps down from Oilers role after missing out on Stanley Cup
description: Wayne Gretzky stepped down as the vice chairman of the Edmonton Oilers on Tuesday after the team was eliminated from the Stanley Cup playoffs in the first round.

title: Spotlight on rookies making early impact in the NHL playoffs
description: For all the talk about how much playoff experience goes into winning the Stanley Cup and the guys with gray in their beards who have been there before, rookies are stealing the show early this NHL postseason.

title: Alex Ovechkin confident he will sign extension with Capitals
description: Alex Ovechkin said Tuesday he is confident he will sign an extension and play again next season for the Washington Capitals franchise he led to the Stanley Cup in 2018.

title: Virus positives play role in first round of NHL playoffs
description: Players testing positive for the coronavirus late in the regular season and at the start of the playoffs affected multiple teams around the NHL despite a high rate of vaccinations.

title: Jets finish off sweep of Oilers with 4-3 victory in 3 OTs
description: Kyle Connor scored 6:52 into the third overtime period, lifting the Winnipeg Jets to a first-round series sweep of the Edmonton Oilers with a 4-3 victory Monday night.

title: Wild stave off elimination with just 14 shots, top Vegas 4-2
description: The Minnesota Wild scored four goals in the first four games of their opening-round playoff tilt with the Vegas Golden Knights and fell behind 3-1 in the series.

title: Islanders stun Pens 3-2 in double OT, take 3-2 series lead
description: New York's Josh Bailey took advantage of a sloppy giveaway by Pittsburgh goaltender Tristan Jarry, sending the puck into the wide-open net 51 seconds into the second overtime to give the Islanders a 3-2 victory in Game 5 on Monday night.

title: Knight time: Rookie saves 36, Panthers top Lightning 4-1
description: The Florida Panthers entrusted their season to a rookie goalie making his playoff debut.

title: Islanders forward Oliver Wahlstrom's head snaps back awkwardly, suffers apparent leg injury on hit
description: New York Islanders forward Oliver Wahlstrom went down hard in the team’s Stanley Cup playoff game against the Pittsburgh Penguins on Monday night.

title: Carolina, Nashville could use a breath — and breathing room
description: Four overtimes. A total of 191 minutes, 4 seconds of hockey. Two hundred and fourteen shots on goal.

title: Bruins solve Capitals in all facets to move on in playoffs
description: Moments after embracing former Boston captain Zdeno Chara in the handshake line, Patrice Bergeron acknowledged he hadn't thought much about what was different about winning his first series with the “C” on his chest.

title: Avalanche looking ahead in playoffs after sweep of Blues
description: Colorado Avalanche winger Gabriel Landeskog didn’t hesitate in admitting that playing on a line centered by standout Nathan MacKinnon is a blast.

title: Jets storm back from 3-goal deficit, top Oilers 5-4 in OT
description: Nikolaj Ehlers scored his second goal of the game at 9:13 in overtime, completing a massive rally for the Winnipeg Jets who erased a three-goal deficit in the third period to beat the Edmonton Oilers 5-4 on Sunday night and take a 3-0 lead in their opening-round playoff series.

title: Bergeron, Pastrnak and Bruins finish off Capitals in 5 games
description: David Pastrnak couldn't control his excitement with the opportunity to help the Boston Bruins advance in the playoffs, and captain Patrice Bergeron approached the clinching game as if it was the reason he played hockey.

title: Avalanche complete 4-game sweep of Blues with 5-2 win

title: Series now even, Islanders aim to keep Crosby, Pens in check
description: The top line of Sidney Crosby, Jake Guentzel and Bryan Rust served as the lone constant for the Pittsburgh Penguins during an injury-plagued regular season, one that ended with a sprint to the East Division championship.

title: Fleury blanks Wild 4-0 as Vegas grabs 3-1 lead in series
description: The stars are scoring for the Vegas Golden Knights, all four lines are producing, and the goaltending has been superb.

title: Maple Leafs beat Canadiens 5-1 in Game 2 to tie series
description: Auston Matthews broke a tie early in the second period and the Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Montreal Canadiens 5-1 in Game 2 on Saturday night to even the first-round playoff series.

title: Sorokin, Islanders beat Penguins 4-1 in Game 4 to tie series
description: After two tough losses, the New York Islanders turned back to Ilya Sorokin in a game they needed to win, and the rookie goalie came through.

title: Killorn, Kucherov pace Lightning's 6-2 rout of Panthers

title: Bruins' Kevan Miller to miss Game 5 after being hospitalized following Capitals' Dmitry Orlov hit

title: Avalanche's Nazem Kadri suspended 8 games for hit to head
description: Colorado Avalanche forward Nazem Kadri was suspended for eight games by the NHL on Friday night for a head shot on St. Louis Blues defenseman Justin Faulk in Game 2 of a first-round playoff series.

title: Matt Duchene scores in 2 OT, Predators beat Hurricanes 5-4
description: Matt Duchene made his first playoff game in Nashville with the Predators a moment to remember.

title: Stastny scores in OT, Jets beat Oilers 1-0 for 2-0 lead
description: Paul Stastny scored at 4:06 of overtime to give the Winnipeg Jets a 1-0 victory over the Edmonton Oilers on Friday night and a 2-0 lead in the first-round series.

title: Avs score 3 in 2nd, beat Blues 5-1 to take a 3-0 series lead
description: Ryan Graves had a goal and two assists, Philipp Grubauer made 31 saves, and the Colorado Avalanche used a three-goal second period to beat the St. Louis Blues 5-1 on Friday night and take a 3-0 series lead in their first-round West Division matchup.

title: Bruins score 3 PPG, beat Capitals 4-1 for 3-1 series lead
description: The Boston Bruins had to cut short one goal celebration to skate to the defense of a teammate, who was taking some abuse from oft-suspended Capitals forward Tom Wilson.

title: Maple Leafs' John Tavares out of the hospital after scary collision, team says
description: Toronto Maple Leafs center John Tavares was released from the hospital Friday just hours after taking a scary hit to the head during a playoff game against the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Maple Leafs, Canadiens players react to John Tavares hit: 'I felt sick to my stomach when I saw it'
description: Montreal Canadiens forward Corey Perry opened up about the hit that knocked Toronto Maple Leafs center John Tavares out of Game 1 of their Stanley Cup playoffs matchup Thursday night.

title: Vegas surges past Wild for 5-2 win to take 2-1 series lead

title: Canadiens beat Maple Leafs 2-1; Tavares injured early
description: Paul Byron broke a tie with a short-handed goal from his knees with 7:16 left and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 on Thursday night in Game 1 of the first-round series between Original Six rivals.

description: On the brink of falling into a deep hole against the reigning Stanley Cup champions, the Florida Panthers refused to concede.

title: Maple Leafs' John Tavares stretchered off ice after hit to head in Game 1 against Canadiens
description: Toronto Maple Leafs captain John Tavares had to be stretchered off the ice during Game 1 of their first-round playoff matchup against the Montreal Canadiens on Thursday night after what appeared to be an incidental collision with Corey Perry.

title: Davidson returns to Blue Jackets as president of hockey ops
description: John Davidson returned to the Columbus Blue Jackets as president of hockey operations on Thursday following his unexpected firing by the New York Rangers earlier this month.

title: Kadri faces another playoff suspension after Faulk headshot
description: Nazem Kadri's head shot on Justin Faulk could send shockwaves through the playoffs for the Colorado Avalanche and the rest of the Stanley Cup contenders.

title: Avalanche's Nazem Kadri to have hearing after 'dangerous' hit on Blues' Justin Faulk
description: Colorado Avalanche centerman Nazem Kadri will have an in-person hearing with the NHL’s Department of Player Safety after a nasty check to the head of St. Louis Blues defenseman Justin Faulk in Game 2 of their first-round playoff series Wednesday night.

title: MacKinnon records hat trick, Avs beat Blues 6-3 in Game 2
description: Nathan MacKinnon had two special guests in the stands — his mom and dad.

title: Helleybuyck makes 32 saves, Jets beat Oilers 4-1 in Game 1
description: Connor Helleybuyck made 32 saves on his 28th birthday, Dominic Toninato broke a tie midway through the third period and the Winnipeg Jets beat the Edmonton Oilers 4-1 on Wednesday night in Game 1 of the first-round playoff series.

title: Aho, Nedeljkovic lift Hurricanes past Predators, 3-0
description: Sebastian Aho scored twice and Alex Nedeljkovic was sharp in net to lead a perfect showing for Carolina's penalty kill, helping the Hurricanes beat the Nashville Predators 3-0 on Monday night in Game 2 of the first-round playoff series.

title: Tkachuk scores twice, Flames beat Canucks 6-2 in finale
description: Matthew Tkachuk scored twice and the Calgary Flames beat the Vancouver Canucks 6-2 on Wednesday in the NHL’s regular-season finale.

title: Fresh Fleury gives Golden Knights big boost vs. Wild
description: The Vegas Golden Knights stuck to a true rotation for their goaltenders down the stretch of the season, alternating Marc-Andre Fleury without much dropoff in performance to Robin Lehner.

title: Blues report virus testing issue to NHL, expect to play Avs
description: The St. Louis Blues reported coronavirus testing problems to the NHL on Wednesday, hours before Game 2 of their first-round playoff series in Denver against the Colorado Avalanche.

title: Leafs, Canadiens meet again in playoffs: ‘Long overdue’
description: Frank Mahovlich can’t pick a side. Who can blame him?

title: Tuch scores twice, Vegas beats Wild to even playoff series
description: The Vegas Golden Knights hadn’t faced a 2-0 deficit in their first eight playoff series since joining the league in 2017.

title: Vasilevskiy stops 32, Lightning top Panthers 3-1 in Game 2
description: A bounce off a Panther. A bounce off a post.

title: Jarry rebounds with 37 saves, Pens even series with Isles
description: Tristan Jarry challenged himself to simply be better following a shaky performance in Pittsburgh's playoff opener.

title: Demko makes 38 saves and Canucks top Flames 4-2
description: Thatcher Demko had 38 saves and the Vancouver Canucks withstood a late barrage Tuesday and held on for a 4-2 victory over the Calgary Flames.

title: Veteran goalies getting their shot in Stanley Cup playoffs
description: For teams in the NHL playoffs Wednesday, there is comfort with having experience – particularly with a Vezina Trophy or a Stanley Cup winner — between the pipes.

title: Bruins-Capitals first round series extends NHL playoff record
description: Brad Marchand scored less than a minute into overtime to even the first-round series between the Boston Bruins and Washington Capitals 1-1 on Monday night but he also extended a pretty impressive playoff record at the same time.

title: MacKinnon, Grubauer lift Avs to 4-1 win over Blues in Game 1
description: Gabriel Landeskog found an early way to calm down the Colorado Avalanche — he dropped the gloves and brawled.

title: Staal, Niederreiter lift Hurricanes past Predators 5-2
description: The Carolina Hurricanes had a building full of rowdy fans again, players back from injury and a strong showing from their captain to help break open a close game.

title: Marchand scores in OT, Bruins beat Capitals to even series
description: All Brad Marchand had to show for the first 60 minutes of Monday night's game was two penalties for post-whistle antics.

title: Intensity from the outset in Sunshine State playoff series
description: The first-ever playoff game between the Tampa Bay Lightning and Florida Panthers could be tough to top.

title: Lindholm's OT goal lifts Flames past Canucks 6-5
description: Elias Lindholm scored the overtime winner and the Calgary Flames bounced back after blowing a four-goal lead in the third period to beat the Vancouver Canucks 6-5 on Sunday night.

title: Point scores 2 in 3rd to lift Lightning over Panthers 5-4
description: For the Tampa Bay Lightning, the return of several key players couldn’t have come at a more opportune time.

title: Eriksson Ek’s OT goal lifts Wild past Vegas 1-0
description: Between hard hitting, fast skating, a torrid pace, spectacular goaltending — Game 1 of the first-round series between the Minnesota Wild and Vegas Golden Knights on Sunday had everything but a goal in regulation.

title: Palmieri's OT winner lifts Isles by Penguins 4-3 in Game 1
description: Kyle Palmieri's second goal of the game 16:30 into overtime lifted the New York Islanders to a 4-3 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in Game 1 of their first-round series on Sunday.

title: Hurricanes, Preds set to open first-round playoff series
description: The Carolina Hurricanes have gone from being mired in a nearly decade-long playoff drought to a division champion armed with postseason experience and success.

title: Nic Dowd scores in OT, Capitals beat Bruins 3-2 in Game 1
description: Nic Dowd deflected in T.J. Oshie's shot from the blue line 4:41 into overtime to give the Washington Capitals a 3-2 victory over the Boston Bruins on Saturday night in Game 1 of the first-round playoff series.

title: Highmore scores twice in 3rd, Canucks beat Oilers 4-1
description: Matthew Highmore scored twice in the third period to help the Vancouver Canucks beat the Edmonton Oilers 4-1 on Saturday.

title: NJ's Ciattarelli touts he's only Republican who can beat Democrat Gov. Murphy
description: A confident Jack Ciattarelli likes to say he’s the only New Jersey Republican who can unseat Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy in this November’s election.

title: Jost scores twice, Avs clinch No. 1 seed with win over Kings
description: Tyson Jost was barely off the ice and already wearing a burgundy shirt commemorating the Colorado Avalanche winning the Presidents' Trophy.

title: Blues score 7 straight goals to beat Wild 7-3
description: David Perron, Brayden Schenn, and Jordan Kyrou each scored twice and the St. Louis Blues scored seven straight goals to erase a first-period deficit and beat the Minnesota Wild 7-3 on Thursday night.

title: Beating the goalie: Top-shelf shots all the rage in the NHL
description: The puck was on Leon Draisaitl's stick for maybe one-tenth of a second before the reigning NHL MVP fired it into the net from an absurd angle between the unsuspecting goaltender's glove hand and the post. The dreaded short-side goal.

title: Seattle Kraken sign Luke Henman as first player ever in franchise history
description: The Seattle Kraken signed free agent center Luke Henman on Wednesday, making him the first player on the roster in franchise history.

title: Norris scores 9 seconds into OT, Senators beat Maple Leafs
description: Josh Norris scored nine seconds into overtime and the Ottawa Senators beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 4-3 on Wednesday night to finish the season.

title: Compher's hat trick lifts Avs over Kings 6-0
description: J.T. Compher scored three goals for his first career hat trick to lead the Colorado Avalanche to a 6-0 win over the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday night.

title: Husso makes 31 stops for first NHL shutout, Blues beat Wild
description: Ville Husso stopped 31 shots for his first career shutout and David Perron had a goal and two assists in the St. Louis Blues' 4-0 victory over the Minnesota Wild on Wednesday night.

title: Golden Knights finish regular season with 6-0 win vs. Sharks
description: Alex Pietrangelo and Keegan Kolesar scored in the first period, Marc-Andre Fleury earned his 67th career shutout and the Vegas Golden Knights finished the regular season with a 6-0 victory Wednesday night over the San Jose Sharks that keeps them alive in the race for the division title.

title: Rangers fire head coach David Quinn after three seasons
description: The New York Rangers' season might be over, but the whirlwind of drama surrounding the organization continued Wednesday when the team fired head coach David Quinn.

title: Wheeler helps Jets beat Canucks, clinch 3rd place in North
description: Blake Wheeler had two goals and two assists, Connor Hellebuyck stopped 24 shots for his fourth shutout of the season, and the Winnipeg Jets beat the Vancouver Canucks 5-0 Tuesday night to clinch third place in the North Division.

title: West-side story: Avs have shot to take division over Knights
description: Gabriel Landeskog recently caught a teammate staring at him over breakfast.

title: Robertson lifts Stars to 5-4 overtime win against Blackhawks
description: Jason Robertson scored 4:30 into overtime, and the Dallas Stars rallied to beat the Chicago Blackhawks 5-4 on Monday night in the final game of the season for each team.

title: Faulk nets winner in OT, Blues beat Kings 2-1
description: Justin Faulk scored 46 seconds into overtime and the St. Louis Blues defeated the Los Angeles Kings 2-1 on Monday night.

title: Avalanche top Golden Knights 2-1, close in on 1st in West
description: Colorado coach Jared Bednar was blunt Monday night when asked how the Avalanche were able to pull out a come-from-behind 2-1 victory over the Vegas Golden Knights.

title: Canadiens clinch playoff spot, lose 4-3 in OT to Oilers
description: Connor McDavid scored 2:42 into overtime for his league-leading 102nd point of the season and the Edmonton Oilers beat Montreal 4-3 in overtime Monday night as the Canadiens clinched the last playoff spot in the North Division.

title: Pekka Rinne notches shutout as Preds beat Hurricanes 5-0
description: Pekka Rinne took a lap around the ice as teammates watched, tapping their sticks against the boards. The Nashville Predators surrounded their 38-year-old goalie for a group hug, and he was the last to leave the ice.

title: Flyers end crushing season with 4-2 win over Devils
description: Gritty stripped off his Philadelphia Flyers jersey and black shorts and left only his green belly button exposed as the final horn sounded.

title: NHL's Canadian teams likely to keep COVID-19 protocols
description: Life is starting to shift back to normal in the National Hockey League — just not for players in Canada.

title: Eichel refers to `disconnect' with Sabres on treating injury
description: Sabres captain Jack Eichel questioned his future in Buffalo on Monday by saying there’s a “a disconnect” with the team on whether to have surgery to repair his herniated disk.

title: Gaudreau, Tkachuk help Flames top Sens, stay in playoff race
description: Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Tkachuk each had a goal and two assists as the Calgary Flames beat the Ottawa Senators 6-1 Sunday night to preserve their slim playoff hopes.

title: Blackhawks beat Stars 4-2 in fans' return to United Center
